column4: It makes a lot of sense to get rid of linux-restricted-modules entirely and just build your own (since this avoids all the cruft with the tmpfs and linking-at-bootup).  (talking running ubuntu edgy on a macbook "1st gen") What is this talking about? Why would i build the linux-restricted-modules on my own? How would i build the linux-restricted-modules myself?
ignore that, its written by a dumbass
